Class BankAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • BankAccount

  • public class BankAccount
extends java.lang.Object
    This class simulates a bank account.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int acc_no
      Account number identifying the account.
      private double balance
      Current balance in the account.
      private java.lang.String firstName
      First name of the account holder.
      private java.lang.String lastName
      Last name of the account holder.
      (package private) static int MAX_TRANSACTIONS_DAY
      The maximum number of transactions that can be performed without incurring a convenience fee.
      (package private) static double MIN_BALANCE
      The minimum balance that every account must have.
      private int num_transactions
      Number of transactions that have been performed using the account on a given day.

        private int acc_no
        Account number identifying the account.

        First name of the account holder.

        Last name of the account holder.

      • balance

        private double balance
        Current balance in the account.

      • num_transactions

        private int num_transactions
        Number of transactions that have been performed using the account on a given day.

      • MIN_BALANCE

        static final double MIN_BALANCE
        The minimum balance that every account must have. This value is 1000.0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_TRANSACTIONS_DAY

        static final int MAX_TRANSACTIONS_DAY
        The maximum number of transactions that can be performed without incurring a convenience fee. This value is 5.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • BankAccount

        public BankAccount(int acc_no)
        Constructor for BankAccount. Initialize the instance variables. Set the balance to MIN_BALANCE and the number of transactions to zero. Since there is no information about the individual's name, set firstName to "John" and lastName to "Doe" and append the account number to lastName.
        Parameters:
        acc_no - integer representing the account number

      • BankAccount

        public BankAccount(int acc_no,
                   double balance)
        Constructor for BankAccount. Initialize the account balance to MIN_BALANCE + the passed argument. The rest of the instance variables are initialized as above.
        Parameters:
        acc_no - integer representing the account number
        balance - double representing the balance in addition to MIN_BALANCE

      • BankAccount

        public BankAccount(int acc_no,
                   java.lang.String email)
        Constructor for BankAccount. Initialize the account balance to MIN_BALANCE and extract the individual's first name and last name from his/her email id. The format of the email id is [first name].[last name][@email.com]. e.g. - Given abcd.efgh@gmail.com, the first name is "Abcd" and the last name is "Efgh". Make sure you capitalize the first character of the names if they aren't already.
        Parameters:
        acc_no - integer representing the account number
        email - String representing the email address in the specified format

      • BankAccount

        public BankAccount(int acc_no,
                   java.lang.String email,
                   double balance)
        Constructor for BankAccount. Initialize the account balance to MIN_BALANCE + the passed argument. The other variables are initialized as above.
        Parameters:
        acc_no - integer representing the account number
        email - String representing the email address in the specified format
        balance - double representing the balance in addition to MIN_BALANCE

    • Method Detail

      • getAccountNumber

        public int getAccountNumber()
        Return the account number.
        Returns:
        integer representing the account number

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Return a string containing the individual's first name and last name, separated by a space.
        Returns:
        String representing the individual's full name in the specified format

      • getBalance

        public double getBalance()
        Return the current balance in the account.
        Returns:
        double representing the current balance in the account

      • deposit

        public int deposit(double amount)
        Deposit the given amount in the account. If the amount is non-positive, return 0. If the number of transactions exceeds MAX_TRANSACTIONS_DAY, a convenience fee of 5% of the deposited amount is charged.
        Parameters:
        amount - double representing the amount to be deposited
        Returns:
        integer that is 1 if the transaction is successful and 0 otherwise

      • withdraw

        public int withdraw(double amount)
        Withdraw the given amount from the account. If amount is negative or zero, return -1. If the number of transactions exceeds MAX_TRANSACTIONS_DAY, charge a convenience fee of 5% of the withdrawn amount. If it is not possible to perform the transaction such that atleast MIN_BALANCE is left after the withdrawal, return 0. If the transaction is completed successfully, return 1.
        Parameters:
        amount - double representing the amount to be withdrawn
        Returns:
        integer that is -1 if amount is negative, 1 if the transaction is completed successfully and 0 otherwise

      • printDetails

        public void printDetails()
        Print the account details in the given format.
        Acc No : ____
        Name : ____
        Balance : ____

        (Name should be in the same format as in the getName() method.)
